newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Austrim sees more growth in 1997/98.
newsitem.headline: Austrim sees more growth in 1997/98.

text.p: Austrim Ltd, the acquisitive investment and manufacturing firm, said on Monday it expected further growth in the current year with its already-healthy order book set to strengthen further.

"To meet increasing demand, the group's ongoing capital expenditure, to improve quality and productivity has been broadened by new investment in additional capacity and increased product development," chairman Alan Jackson said in a statement accompanying the 1996/97 profit result.
"The directors are confident that the group will enjoy further growth in 1997/98," Jackson said.
Austrim earlier announced a 1996/97 (July-June) net profit of A$21.91 million from a year-ago profit of A$4.41 million.
It also said it would make a two-for-five rights issue to raise A$208 million to reduce debt and for additional working capital.
